nodes.bodyText: I'd prefer roleAlias is retrieved in CredentialRequestHandler constructor
Yeah that was irksome, it is done in CredentialRequestHandler's constructor now
Is this defined by S3 or evergreen?

By Evergreen, we are not using S3s built in integrity check support because that uses MD5 and we wanted to avoid using MD5. Instead this was the simplest way to keep the algorithm also dynamic so that in future when we want to start using a newer algorithm both cloud and device can do that seamlessly
It's not just checksum, should we add extra field to include algorithm?
Changed it, although I feel it's unnecessarily long recipe key, let me know if you can think of a better name
For the greengrass component, we need to add similar integrity check. This constructor might not be necessary.
Okay, I removed this one
Do we have URI validation error defined? If not, should we have one? It's kind of client exception. Probably should distinguished from internal error.
Added a new exception for invalid URI
Recommend to break the function to subroutines (for example, retrieve credential, get object, validate integrity), handle specific exception for each subroutines.
Done
Why is a JsonNode instead of a modeled type?
This gets modeled into either AWSCredentials or just a byte[] in two of the consumers that call this method anyway, modeling it here wouldn't be of much help
TES now has caching, so it should have a method to get the credentials without doing all of what you've added.
Curious, are we following 'camelCase' or 'CamelCase' naming convention for json field?
CamelCase, checksum is one word though and it has been changed now
does saveToPath have separate directory for each package? Or all package's artifact is saved under same dir?
Nvm I checked it's the package specific path. I saw the package Identifier is passed into the function and assumed that this function will resolve dir to download
Are you returning credentialProvider even with AWSIotException?
NIT: don't log and throw the exception at the same time
NIT: make "eg-e2e-tests-component-artifacts-test" a variable
Can this be in aftereach?
No, in one of the tests it becomes unreachable and throws UnnecessaryStubbingException
let's make sure these are always random, otherwise we will run into concurrent run issues. A random suffix would be fine
Zhaoyan has similar code added, probably should use her's
we'll probably want this kind of thing in a utility
This is temporary until cloud adds the checksum calculation logic and recipe model so it's better in this one place which will be easier to clean up
this is not cross platform. Use @TempDir to get a temp dir and then create the file in itt
why not just have TES implement this interface?
Injecting the kernel to get the context to get TES doesn't seem right at all. Why not just inject TES in the constructor?

That's what I had tried but the injecting this needs DeviceConfiguration settings present in order to establish a connection with IoT cloud. That causes all integ tests that need a package manager instance to fail since the injection happens all the way upto DeploymentService and they don't have that step to do the device configuration settings. This way, you get an instance on demand and can do the settings only in the places you need them
Why not mock out DeviceConfiguration in integ, then?

Since in most of our integ tests we create an instance of kernel and launch in each test case so this will need refactoring in almost all integ tests, since kernel also tries to startup deployment service every time. I agree that that is a better approach but given the size of this PR already I will most likely do that in a follow up PR

I don't like how this flips responsibility. Why not just use TES (even if it isn't running as a service), to get the credentials. Let TES call the functions in this class and provide the credentials through the AwsCredentialsProvider  interface,

I don't agree that it's 'flipping responsibility'. If you want to use TES you must have an instance of credential request handler at all times. Adding this to the TES interface means you also need one additional object for TES. The original author exposed a method to get creds directly for the kernel on this CredentialRequestHandler class so I used that object to get creds without http server.
Anyway, after rebasing on multiple changes to TES it was easier for me to use TES instead so I've added this method to TES now
what about when the role alias changes? Should this go inside the subscribe call?
Done
you could have TES implement the interface, then you can just pass TES into the AWS client and it will simply work.
Done
NIT: we can just have one UUID for the test run, and remove it afterwards.

I think the listener on role alias topic update in L51 doesn't change this credentialRequestHandler here. Either the IoTConnectionManager need to perform the listen-and-update or you update the server impl here

Yes, although this has always been like this, currently change in role alias and even port only takes effect when the service starts up again. It will be better for TES to either restart itself or restart the http server on every change, I can't take up this added scope in this PR though, I'll create a bug for it
NIT: I feel it's actually simpler in code to create an actual Configuration and Topic object

This was moved from before start to here, TES seems like it's actively undergoing lots of changes so I imagine all of the improvements will be made as part of that, for tracking on our side, I can list down these points and we can decide how that can be closed
Does this return response even on AwsIOTException?
Yes, it appears that it was left for a follow up that the TODO describes, for properly handling various types of errors
inject context instead of kernel?
Why not inject TES in the constructor? You're already injecting some stuff.
This was discussed earlier, I will need a follow up PR for addressing that #300 (comment)
Need to synchronize around this/when using the request handler. Maybe use an AtomicReference.
Done
put in finally. There's an assertion right above this which could fail and cause it not to clean up.
should this package have a UUID to make it unique?
I don't think this actually creates a component in cloud
why make a new context? You can get the existing context from kernel.getContext()
I just  borrowed if from existing tests, not sure if there was a specific reason to do it this way to get a list of root packages
We need to delete the bucket
Why not just leave the bucket?
looks like maybe a mixed up merge? I think I've seen this change before in someone else's PR.
I've only moved the kernel setup to BeforeAll instead of doing that in all tests individually, other than that there'e no change
just use @AllArgsConstructor and @NoArgsConstructor, no need for the manual constructor.
This seems a bit sketchy, doesn't the S3 client have some way to take a s3:// URL and parse it itself, instead of us parsing it?
The SDK that we are using does not have a provision for that, we also need to get bucket and key name so that the file path uses the key name
if it passed the check, I don't think we need an info level log.
[nit]
Still here.
I thought I fixed it, finally actually did it now
don't hard code paths. Use a @TempDir. This won't work on windows.
these need to be in an @After or finally, otherwise if the test fails, it won't be cleaned up.
Why have sleep here?
Not sure, this code was moved from individual tests to here, didn't get a chance to fix it, if it can be fixed that is
why not read bytes from VALID_ARTIFACT_CONTENT directly?
Checksum for just the content vs checksum for it saved as file comes out to be different for some reason
